newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-UNITED STATES SET SECOND FASTEST 4X100 RELAY TIME.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-UNITED STATES SET SECOND FASTEST 4X100 RELAY TIME.

text.p: The United States, anchored by Olympic 100 metres champion Gail Devers, set the second fastest time ever in the world women's 4x100 relay final on Saturday.
Devers, who was given a wild card to compete in the championships as the defending 100 metres hurdles champion, ran the final leg for the Americans who clocked 41.47 seconds.
The new world 100 gold medallist Marion Jones ran the second leg.
East Germany set the world record of 41.37 seconds at the World Cup in Canberra 12 years ago.
